author: tony
post: There are only two good points made by skeptics on the manuscript. 1) That the image of Jesus has no beard, as does the man on the shroud. 2) That there is no image of the man on the cloth in the second picture. The second is weak, but acceptable–just barely. The cloth is shown folded over, and if the artist were to put an image on the cloth, no one would think that Jesus was somehow no longer in the tomb. That said, I still think that the image on the manuscript was based on the shroud..
title: A Masterly Demolition of the Hungarian Pray Manuscript?
